page.title: 15Stoke Wood 2
page.content: In 1984 Stoke Wood was bought by the Woodland Trust with the help of the World Wildlife Fund. The birds and the plants are protected. The wardens are Mr.M. Carpenter, Mrs.L. O'Kane and Mrs.V. Parish. From April 1984 a group of volunteers manages the wood at weekends. Plants of interest include the Tway Blade Orchid, White Butterfly Orchid, Spotted Orchid and Early Purple Orchid as well as more common plants. The animals include deer, badgers and rabbits. The Northern part of Stoke Wood belongs to the Naturalist Trust.
